title: Taliyah Feedback: I appreciate that you tried not having W vector cast, but it's a mistake
body: I've been playing with Taliyah in a few comp games.  I have to say, after seeing how fluid it is to cast Viktor's laser vs the irritation I still feel at casting her W, please make W a vector-cast spell.  I appreciate that you tried something new, but it is the wrong decision.  Please change it to cast like every other directional ability in the game:  Make it vector-cast.  The double-click thing is disruptive and unintuitive.

replies.body: I wonder if they could just make things like that optional.
Why SMARTCASTING requires two button inputs is what drives me off the wall. At least make it use vector for that type of control like it's meant to.
Is it killing you to have to click twice? you barely have to mouse from the w location to select a direction its so simple i dont see the isue

For a few reasons, yes. 

-Zenon arbitrarily chose to create a new casting paradigm instead of using an established control scheme.
-Taliyah's W is the ONLY skill in the game that requires two button presses in order to function using smart casting (which isn't a mobility spell with two very different functions like Leblanc, Zed, Fizz), making it very clunky for that control scheme. 
-Using W locks you out of using any other spell. 
-It's slower than vector targeting mechanically;

Button down>Button up>Move mouse>Button up>Button down    vs;
Button down>move mouse>Button up

Not only that, but vector targeting would ensure that partial spell success (i.e.: knock up without directional input) never happened unless the player truly desired it to.

The reason it's not vector cast is because you don't have to choose a direction and can just knock somebody up. You don't have to always fling them somewhere.

That's not much an excuse for its rather clunky targetting paradigm though. Especially if you're used to smartcasting which requires only one input to cast literally every other spell but this one, it makes a champion who is already so heavily reliant on comboing really awkward to play and use.

Having at least a Vector-like targetting paradigm that lets you choose a direction by dragging when you cast would make her feel so much more intuitive. I appreciate that they wanted to try something different with her W, but her current cast paradigm is unintuitive and clunky, which is the exact opposite of what she needs.
